conclusion: Problem involves shadows of four objects labeled A, B, C, and D.
Need to determine changes in position and size of shadows when light source moves to the back right.
Understanding of shadows: formed when an object blocks light, position depends on light source.
Position of shadow changes with light source direction: front light causes shadow behind, side light causes side shadow, overhead light causes shadow below.
Four objects: an apple, a piece of paper, another apple, and a chicken leg casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
Wooden surface is likely horizontal, light source at an angle creating shadows.
Light source moving to 'back right' means opposite direction if originally from front left.
Original direction of light source is unspecified.
Shadows move in opposite direction to light source movement.
Shadow length changes with light angle: shorter if overhead, longer if shallow angle.
Uncertainty about original and new direction relative to objects.
Consider each shadow individually due to lack of specific light direction.
Shadow of apple labeled A will move opposite to light source movement.
